messages.title: Three things to remember this election
messages.content: LABOUR ARE NOT WORKING HARD ENOUGH. CONSERVATIVES CAN’T WIN HERE: ONLY JOHN CAN BEAT LABOUR. JOHN HAS FOUGHT FOR THIS AREA; HE WORKS HARD ALL YEAR ROUND.

messages.title: My Promise of More:
messages.content: Fight to reverse cuts to mental health services. I voted against the bedroom tax. I would vote to scrap it. It is hurting our community. Lib Dems will invest £6bn into our NHS; Paid for by increasing income tax by 1p in every £1. £60m investment to end homelessness in the UK. Oppose Theresa May’s Dementia Tax. I will stand up for a care system that we can rely on. Support the Lib Dem call for an extra £16m for Greater Manchester Police to fight crime. Tackle the issue of air pollution in our city and Parliament. Action to tackle climate change.

leaflet.personalStatement: When I was first elected to represent people in South Manchester I was the youngest councillor. My commitment to you is as strong now as it was 20 years ago. As your Lib Dem MP, and earlier this year I represented you on a national stage when I asked Prime Minister’s question in a packed House of Commons.
